snippet: An extension would serve three purposes for the Obama administration: it would increase the number of insured people while reducing anger at the White House and opposition to the Affordable Care Act from those penalized.
abstract: Senate Democrats ask Pres Obama to extend registration time for consumers to enroll in health plans; administration considers 'special enrollment period' that would serve to increase number of people with insurance, reduce number who would pay tax penalties and ensure that more people have personal stake in Supreme Court case challenging health insurance subsidies.
lead_paragraph: An extension would serve three purposes for the Obama administration: it would increase the number of insured people while reducing anger at the White House and opposition to the Affordable Care Act from those penalized.

headline.main: Senate Democrats Lobby for a Reprieve for Some Who Failed to Get Insurance
headline.print_headline: Senate Democrats Lobby for a Reprieve for Some Who Failed to Get Insurance

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
